page.title: 13Tourism in Mumbles
page.content: Mumbles is a major centre for tourism. On summer evenings crowds gather to stroll and watch windsurfers and dinghy sailors.Oystermouth Castle is a 13th Century fortress overlooking the bay.For children there are parks and amusements as well as a Helter Skelter at the entrance to the Pier, which juts out 800 feet into the bay. Hotels charge from Â£15 to Â£25 a night, while guest houses only cost between Â£6 and Â£10 a night.Behind the promenade the main road is full of hotels,guest houses and restaurants. Fishermen's cottages are set into the steep hillside.Some of these can be rented in the holiday season.Many tourists come for the fine beaches of Bracelet,Limeslade,Rotherslade and Langland. By Stephen Diehl
